description.english: Tutorial clear! Let's keep up the good work as Hamonaiza! (Yum)
description.japanese: チュートリアルクリアデス！これからハモナイザとしてガンバリマッショ。（ユム）

description.english: Yeah, let's go through the ruins, little by little. There's no need to rush.So, please don't be reckless. (Hina)
description.japanese: うん、少しずつ、進んでいこう。焦る必要はないからね、無茶はしないようにね。（ヒナ）

description.english: Yes yes! We're well on our way through the ruins! Let's keep going up to the next level! (Yum)
description.japanese: 順調に廃墟進んでるデス！どんどこ上目指すデス！（ユム）

description.english: Let's just go through the ruins and catch the former Demon King. Let's finish it quickly. (???)
description.japanese: さっさと進んで早く元魔王とやらを捕まえようぜ。（？？？）

description.english: All sorts of people come to Hell. The longer you don't mind, the longer you can keep going good life. Well, let's aim for the next level. (Yum)
description.japanese: 地獄は色々な方来るデス。気にしない方が長く続けられるデス。それはそれとして上目指しましょ。（ユム）

description.english: When we are harmonizers, we are asked to do a lot of different jobs. Sometimes we get to consult on the residents' problems, sometimes we get to run around the ruins. Yeah, it's a lot of things. (Hina)
description.japanese: 調和者をやっていると、色んな仕事を任されるね。お悩み相談もあれば廃墟を駆け回ることも。うん、色々だ。（ヒナ）

description.english: Hamonaiza, we're always looking for you! If you're interested, check out the employment information and work rules! That's about it, hahaha. (Yum)
description.japanese: ハモナイザいつでも募集中デス！気になるアナタは採用情報・就業規則を要チェック！みたいなデス。（ユム）

description.english: In Hell, we receive a lot of letters, packages, and other things from outside of Hell. From Heaven, Interval, and many other places. (Hina)
description.japanese: 地獄にはね、手紙とか、荷物とか、結構地獄の外から色々届くんだ。天国とか、狭間とか、色々な場所からね。（ヒナ）

description.english: There's the former Demon King on the level 10. Let's just capture them and finish the training! At any rate, this ruin is a tall building. It's not good for our legs. (Yum)
description.japanese: 第10層に元魔王とやらいるデス。さささと捕まえて研修終えるデス。しかし高い建物デス、足に良くないデス。（ユム）

description.english: Ah, yes, let's catch the former Demon King. When we catch them, I guess we'll have a sermon contest... (Hina)
description.japanese: あ、うん、元魔王？を捕まえよう。捕まえたら、お説教大会かな……。（ヒナ）

description.english: The 20th of every month is our payday. Yeah, let's think carefully about how we spend our money. (Hina)
description.japanese: 毎月20日は給料日だ。うん、使い道はよく考えようね。（ヒナ）

description.english: The transporter room, you see, is a facility that you can use to transfer goods. Why don't you give it a [TRY]? (Leeds)
description.japanese: 転送室はですね、物資の転送にお使いいただける施設です。一度『おためし』してはいかがでしょうか。（リーズ）

description.english: The employment office is exactly what the name implies. If you're short on staff, you should come by. (Heathersh)
description.japanese: 雇用所は名前の通りの施設だ。人材不足なら一度来てみると良い。（ヘザーシュ）

description.english: Ah, do you have fragments of the book? If you have them, please come to the binding room. I'll repair it. (Imram)
description.japanese: 書の切れ端はお持ちですか～？お持ちでしたら、ぜひ、製本室にいらしてください。修繕します～。（イムラム）

displayName.english: One Year Passed Since Become a Harmonizer

description.english: It's been a year since you came to this section! Time goes by so fast. I feel like I'm getting older. Let's continue to have fun in the future. (Yum)
description.japanese: 研修始めた日から1年！早いデス。ワタクシ歳ひとつ重ねた感じデス。今後とも楽しくやっていきましょ。（ユム）

description.english: Yeah, it's also our job to capture the people who got away. First our goal is 5 people. (Hina)
description.japanese: うん、逃げた住民の確保も私達の仕事だね。5名ぐらい捕まえられると良いな。（ヒナ）

description.english: It looks like there are quite a few people still living in the ruins. I guess our goal is to capture 15 of them. (Hina)
description.japanese: 結構な人数の住民がまだ廃墟にいるみたいだ。15名ぐらいは捕まえたいかな。（ヒナ）

description.english: Looks like there are still some of the inhabitants left in the ruins. I wonder if we'll capture them all and have a sermon contest. (Hina)
description.japanese: 廃墟にはまだ逃げた住民が残ってるみたいだ。全員捕まえて、お説教大会かな。（ヒナ）

description.english: The rating of Hamonaiza is very important. The higher it is, the higher the salary will be. First, let's aim for rank 10. (Yum)
description.japanese: ハモナイザの格、大変大事デス。これ上がるとお給金もほんのり上がるデス。まずは10ぐらい目指すデス。（ユム）

description.english: Hamonaiza's rating, it's important. This will also be asked in the exam. Well, it's a lie, hahaha. Let's aim for a good Hamonaiza. So, let's aim for rank of 25. (Yum)
description.japanese: ハモナイザの格、大変大事デス。ココ試験に出るデス。嘘デス。優良ハモナイザ目指してガンバリマッショ。25ぐらい目指すデス。（ユム）

description.english: The rating of the Hamonaiza is very important. Let's accumulate work and trust to become a high Hamonaiza. When you reach rank 50, you're a full-fledged Hamonaiza! (Yum)
description.japanese: ハモナイザの格、大変大事デス。仕事と信頼を積み重ねてステキハモナイザなるデス。50もいったら一人前デス。（ユム）

description.english: Even in Hell, you still need money to shop. If I have about 50,000 coins, we can buy a lot of things. (Hina)
description.japanese: 地獄でもやっぱりお金って大事みたいだ。コイン5万くらいあれば、色々買えるかな。（ヒナ）

displayName.english: Let's Try to Get Make 100,000 Coins

description.english: Shops are a good place for us to get ready to explore. In that case, yeah, we'll need some coins. I feel like I could buy a lot of stuff with 100,000 coins. (Hina)
description.japanese: お店で探索準備を整えるには、うん、コインが必要だね。10万もあれば、良いものが買える気がする。（ヒナ）

displayName.english: Let's Try to Get Make 250,000 Coins

description.english: The section's shops will also sell products to the Harmonizers that they do not sell to other residents. I feel like I can buy whatever I want with 250,000 coins. (Hina)
description.japanese: 区のお店って、相手が調和者だと色々売ってくれるらしいよ。コインが25万もあれば、好きなものが買える気がする。（ヒナ）

displayName.english: Let's Make a Shopping Spree Worth 50,000 Coins!

description.english: If you need to do shopping, come on down to Hellmart! Well, other shops are fine, too. The best way to learn about the section is to shop! How about spending a quick 50,000 coins? I'd also recommend having a meal. (Galan)
description.japanese: 買い物でしたら、是非ヘルマートへ！ま、他でも良いっすけど。区のことを知るなら買い物が一番！ぱーっと5万くらい使ってみたらどうすかね。飯食うのもおすすめっす。（ガラン）

displayName.english: Let's Make a Shopping Spree Worth 100,000 Coins!

description.english: Hellmart is open all year round! The pay for that is... well, that's just the way it is. The best way to learn about the section is to shop! Why don't you try spending 100,000 coins or so quickly? There are all sorts of shops, like toolmaker and stuffed animal shop. (Galan)
description.japanese: ヘルマートは年中無休！その割に給料は・・・・・・まぁ、そういうもんっす。区のことを知るなら買い物が一番！ぱーっと10万くらい使ってみたらどうすかね。武器屋とかぬいぐるみ屋とか、色んなお店があるっすよ。（ガラン）

displayName.english: Let's Make a Shopping Spree Worth 250,000 Coins!

description.english: Be sure to head over to Hellmart for your magazine! There are no magazines in the library. The best way to learn about the section is to shop! Why don't you try spending 250,000 coins or so quickly? You could buy some jewelry. (Galan)
description.japanese: 雑誌をお買い求めの際は是非ヘルマートへ！雑誌は基本図書室に置かれないらしいっす。区のことを知るなら買い物が一番！ぱーっと25万くらい使ってみたらどうすかね。宝石とか買えそうっすね。（ガラン）

description.english: There's a lot to discover when we explore every nook and cranny, I highly recommend it, let's explore all 5 or so. (Yum)
description.japanese: 隅から隅まで探索すると色々発見があるデス、オススメデス。5箇所くらい全部探索するデス。（ユム）

description.english: Hamonaiza does a lot of footwork. Exploring is a daily occurrence. Thanks to this, my shoes are always overworked. But aside from that, let's explore all 10 places. (Yum)
description.japanese: ハモナイザは足を使う仕事多いデス。探索なんて日常茶飯事デス。ところでサハンジって何デス？それはそれとして、10箇所くらい全部探索するデス。（ユム）

description.english: We find a lot of things as we explore. Mushrooms, cabbages and so on. It's a good idea to get used to exploring and to be able to call yourself a exploration master. We'll explore all 15 or so places. (Yum)
description.japanese: 探索してると色々見つけるデス。キノコとかキャベツとか色々デス。探索慣れて探索マスター名乗れるようになるとイイデス。15箇所くらい全部探索するデス。（ユム）

description.english: There is a training center for harmonizers in the section. You can choose from four different training course. Any of them will do, but you might want to complete one first. (Chief)
description.japanese: 区には調和者向けの訓練所がある。訓練所は4種類から選ぶことができる。どれでも良いが、まずは1つ修了してみたらどうだろうか。（室長）

description.english: There are also more advanced training centers available. Any of them will do, but you might want to try completing one first. Don't loosen up, even if it's training. (Chief)
description.japanese: 訓練所にはより上級の訓練所も用意されている。どれでも良いが、まずは1つ修了してみたらどうだろうか。訓練といえど気は緩めないように。また、訓練だけに熱中しないように。良い塩梅を心がけてほしい。（室長）

displayName.japanese: リミスのステキな訓練所修了

description.english: I'm currently working on creating my own awesome training center. I hope you'll experience and completion of the course. (Rimis)
description.japanese: 現在、俺なりにステキな訓練所の作成を考案中だ。一度修了まで付き合ってくれないか？（リミス）

description.english: Hamonaiza's work includes solving the problems of the residents of the section. Let's start by solving about 5 cases. (Yum)
description.japanese: ハモナイザの仕事には区の住民のお悩み解決あるデス。まずは5件くらい解決するデス。（ユム）

description.english: Residents of the section have a lot of problems. This is a painful headache. If you can help, good luck with that. Let's resolve about 10 of them and get the hang of it. (Yum)
description.japanese: 区の住民は色々お悩みデス、頭痛が痛いデス。ハモナイザが解決できる内容なら助けてあげるとイイデス。15件くらい解決してコツ掴むデス。（ユム）

description.english: When we live in a section, we need a lot of things. As a hamonaiza, let's do our best to make the lives of our residents better. Once you resolve 30 of their problems, you'll be used to it. (Yum)
description.japanese: 区で生活してると色々必要になるデス。住民の生活をよりイイものにするべくハモナイザとしてガンバリマッショ。お悩み30件も解決すれば慣れたものデス。（ユム）

description.english: You can give the residents a variety of presents. They'll be especially happy if it's something they like. So why don't you give them 30 of them? (Hina)
description.japanese: 食べ物とか、うん、色々プレゼントすると喜ばれるよ。好みのものだと良いみたい。30個くらいプレゼントしてみたらどうかな。（ヒナ）

description.english: Often, what you don't need is very necessary to someone else. So, yes, it's a good idea to deliver them to someone who needs them. Let's take the plunge and give about 60 presents. (Hina)
description.japanese: 自分自身は必要でないものも、他の誰かにとってはとても必要なもの、ということはよくあるね。だから、うん、必要な誰かの元に届けてあげると良いんじゃないかな。思い切って、60個くらいプレゼントしてみたら良いかも。（ヒナ）

description.english: It would be nice to be able to thank the residents of the section for their help or something like that, who have been with us in our exploration. Yeah, maybe we could give them 100 presents. (Hina)
description.japanese: 私達の探索に付き合ってくれている区の住民に、お世話になっているお礼とかできると良いかな。うん、そうだね、100個くらいプレゼントしてみたらどうかな。（ヒナ）

description.english: You've chosen Moduku as your collaborator. That's a good choice. However, just as the word <the right person for the right job> exists, so too do Moduku have their own strengths and weaknesses. Even if Moduku is a seaweed that is beyond the reach of human knowledge, I would say no, if you ask me if it is best to take it to all places. At any rate, you should enjoy [THE WORLD OF MODUKU]. (Moduku)
description.japanese: もづくを仲間にしたか。なるほど、それは良い選択をしたと言える。言うまでもないことだが、豊かな人生にもづくはつきものだからな。しかし、世の中には適材適所という言葉が存在するように、もづくにも得意不得意は存在している。いくらもづくが人智の及ばぬ海藻であったとしても、全ての場所にもづくを連れて行くことが最良かと問われれば、それは否と答える。故に調和者にはもづくの使い所を見極めてほしい。何はともあれ『もづくのせかい』を堪能するが良い。（もづく）

displayName.japanese: 今日からキャベツ農家

description.english: Are you going to start keeping cabbages, too? They peel off pretty easily, so please treat them well. (Rafilz)
description.japanese: 調和者さんもキャベツ飼うんですか。連中、結構むけやすいから、大事に扱ってやってくださいね。（ラフィルツ）

description.english: [WELCOME TO INTERVAL]. Interval is that space between the world of the dead and the world of the living, where the dead are assigned to go to Heaven or Hell. I send a lot of people to hell every day. I leave it to the harmonizers in Hell to deal with the rest. Good luck. Yeah, it's roughly like this. (Interval Administrator)
description.japanese: やぁ、いらっしゃい。『はざまのせかい』にようこそ。狭間は、死者の世界と生者の世界の狭間にあってね、ここに来た死者を天国に行くか地獄に行くか、割り振ってるんだよ。毎日沢山地獄に送ってるかな、うん。ああ、送った後のことはそっち任せなんだ。振り分け間違えることは無いと思うんだけど、まぁ、よろしくね。（狭間の管理人）
